publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Most Humbly Dedicated to the Ingenious Mr. Arbuckle Author of the Dublin Weekly Journal.
Odi profanum Vulgus & arceo. ··Hor.
A Writer held in great Renown,
By all News-Boys of the Town
Who ne're (as I imagine) Rose
Above the Vulgar turn of Prose,
Seeing so many Younkers Dabble
In Poetry to please the Rabble,
Like AEsop's Frog, with Envy swell'd,
The daring Phaetons beheld,
Nothing it seem's with him wou'd down,
This rais'd his Laugh, and that his frown;
What e're they Writ, was Stuff or Fustian,
And all was sentenc'd to Combustion,
In short, Sir, not a single Cantor
Of all the Tribe Escap'd his Banter,
Now having with a deal of Pleasure,Anatomis'd their Rhime and Measure,
Weigh'd ev'ry Thought, and Word & Letter
Think's he,──my self cou'd Jingle better,
Resolv'd to put it to the Test
How far he cou'd excel the Rest.
He Whips me on his Sunday Cloath's,
And bid a dieu to Mistriss Prose;
By no perswasion wou'd he stay,
But to Parnassus bent his way,
Where having reach'd, with due submission,
To th' Nine presents his poor Petition,
Miss Clio, having paus'd a while,
Return'd him Answer in this Stile,
“Sir Phaebus made a Declaration
“'gainst all Lame Members i' the Nation;
“Nor do's he ever think that those
“Shou'd run in Rhime, who Limp in Prose,Arb────heard,────but heard with Anger,
And in his Heart cou'd find to Hang her,
His Nails he bites his Breast he thumps,
And so depart'd in the Dumps─────
But as your Bullies game the more,
Nor yet, by losing, quit the score;
So he, possess'd with double flame,
Soon after to Parnassus came;
And hurri'd on by more Ambition
In person back's his old Petition,
Beg'd, Pray'd, and Beg'd and pray'd again,
Us'd ev'ry Tone;─────but all in Vain.
At last upon a certain Day
To Phaebus CLIO takes her Way;
And flying thro' her beaten Road
Soon reach'd the Radiant God's Abode,
To whom she, after a good Morrow,
In Canting Stile express'd her sorrow,
Told,─────that a Scab Yclep'd Arb────
Did often to her Sisters Truckle,
And turn'd Parnassus to a Stage──────
Ay, Dame? Reply'd the Reverend Sage,
By Jove I's make that Grubstreet scraper,
E'er I to Bed go, cut a Caper,
He'll find, if he comes in my Clutches,
But small Assistance from his Crutches!
Eft soons they both, like Swallows Fly
Down from Olympus thro' the Sky,
And coming near Parnassus View'd
Our Interloper over Rude,
In dreadful Armour rushing on
To gain the Muses pro, or Con;
But CLIO nearer now approaching,
Cries out you Villain, art Incroaching?
You Farthing Journalist─────Hey Day!
Methinks you're Armed Cap-a-pe
Here CLIO say's the angry God,
Go, get me a good Birchen Rod.
The best you find on Mount Parnassus,
Such tricks as these shall never pass us:
This done.──he lays upon his Backside,
(And doubtless he left him a Blackside,
At last dismissing him,────now go,
Still to remain in STATU QUO;
And henceforth know this Hill, he says,
Produces Birch as well as Bay's.
